title: Promise Error Handling
description: Handle errors in promises with catch
instructions:
Write a function `divideAsync(a, b)` that returns a Promise. If b is 0, reject with the error 'Cannot divide by zero'. Otherwise, resolve with a / b.

Example: divideAsync(10, 2) resolves to 5
Example: divideAsync(10, 0) rejects with 'Cannot divide by zero'

hints.content: Promises have both resolve and reject callbacks. Use reject for error cases.
Check if b === 0 inside the Promise. If true, call reject with the error message. Otherwise, call resolve with a / b.
Use: `return new Promise((resolve, reject) => { if (b === 0) { reject('Cannot divide by zero'); } else { resolve(a / b); } });`
